action.action-desc: Mr. McGovern (for himself and Ms. Pressley) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services

form.official-title: To provide grants to owners of intergenerational dwelling units, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited to as the Grandfamily Housing Act of 2023.

subsection.text: Title II of the LEGACY Act of 2003 (12 U.S.C. 1790q note) is amended by adding at the end the following:
The Secretary shall, not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this section, establish a program to provide grants to owners of intergenerational dwelling units.

To be eligible to receive a grant under this section, an owner of an intergenerational dwelling unit shall submit an application to the Secretary at such time, in such manner, and containing such information as the Secretary may reasonably require.
An owner of an intergenerational dwelling unit that receives a grant under this section shall use amounts provided to cover costs associated with—

subparagraph.text: offer onsite services to intergenerational families, including tutoring, health care services, afterschool care, and activities that are age appropriate for children of various ages of development; and
coordinate with any local kinship navigator program (as described in section 474(a)(7) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 674(a)(7));

paragraph.text: facilitating outreach to intergenerational families as described in subsection (d);
planning and providing services to intergenerational families; and
retrofitting and maintaining existing spaces within the property that contains the intergenerational dwelling unit for the services and programs provided to intergenerational families.

An owner of an intergenerational dwelling unit that receives a grant under this section shall engage with intergenerational families in the community surrounding the property that contains the grandfamily housing owned by the grant recipient by—

subparagraph.text: planning and offering events for intergenerational families.

paragraph.text: Outreach under this subsection shall, where possible, be in coordination with a local kinship navigator program (as described in section 474(a)(7) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 674(a)(7)) or a comparable program or entity in the State in which the intergenerational dwelling unit is located.

subsection.text: There are authorized to be appropriated to the Secretary such sums as may be necessary to carry out this section for each of fiscal years 2024 through 2028.
The program established under this section shall be implemented by the Secretary in a manner that is consistent with the Fair Housing Act (42 U.S.C. 3601 et seq.).
Section 41411(a)(3) of the Violence Against Women Act of 1994 (34 U.S.C. 12491(a)(3)) is amended—

paragraph.text: by redesignating subparagraphs (O) and (P) as subparagraphs (P) and (Q), respectively; and
by inserting after subparagraph (N) the following:

subparagraph.text: the program established under section 206 of the LEGACY Act of 2003;

subsection.text: Not later than 2 years after the date of enactment of this section, the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development shall submit to the Congress a report that—

paragraph.text: describes the effectiveness of the grant program established under section 206 of the LEGACY Act of 2003, as added by subsection (a); and
makes recommendations for legislative changes that could allow for the grant program to be more effective.
